experiences.experience-company: Faculty of Medicine Peer Mentorship Program
experiences.experience-text: Supported a junior graduate student through their transition into graduate school. I helped them apply to teaching and research assistantships, as well as develop connections and access resources on campus.

experiences.experience-company: Vancouver Summer Program - Obstetrics and Gynecology
experiences.experience-text: Presented a lecture entitled: Histology of the Female Reproductive System and developed an afternoon interactive lab session on histology. The students performed H&E staining and then learned to identify endometriosis under a microscope, as well as other histological structures.

experiences.experience-company: Vancouver Summer Program - Obstetrics and Gynecology
experiences.experience-text: Presented a lecture entitled: Histology of the Female Reproductive System and developed an afternoon interactive lab session on histology. The students performed H&E staining and then learned to identify endometriosis under a microscope, as well as other histological structures.

experiences.experience-company: Vancouver Summer Program - Obstetrics and Gynecology
experiences.experience-text: Presented a lecture entitled: Endometriosis: Let's Talk About Painful Sex.
Taught the urinary and respiratory units for the course: Introduction to Microscopic Human Anatomy (CAPS390).

experiences.experience-company: Mini Med School, BC Children's Hospital Research Institute
experiences.experience-text: Conducted a hands-on workshop session on laparoscopic surgery at the Mini Med Kamloops and Williams Lake workshops for high school students.
Described my research experience as a women in a STEM field to a group of female high school students, and ran a hands-on histology lab demonstration.
Provided undergraduate students at UBC with advice and support as they create a research project and poster to present at the Multidisciplinary Undergraduate Research Conference.
Teaching Assistant for a course entitled: The Principles of Human Morphology II (ANAT215).
